reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Strengthening Prevention and patient-centered Integrated Care in order to end tuberculosis in Chad

description.narrative: Chad - Tuberculosis - Ministry of Public Health and National Solidarity - MOH. This program has the following goals: Reduce mortality rate for tuberculosis from 31 deaths per 100,000 inhabitants in 2016 to 23.3 deaths per 100,000 inhabitants in 2022. Reduce the incidence of tuberculosis from 153 NC/100,000 inhabitants in 2016 to 132 NC/100,000 habitants by 2022. Secure universal access for the population to quality, global, integrated and continuous healthcare centred on the person with a view to making an effective contribution to the socio-economic development of the country.. The objectives of this program are: Ensure prevention and integrated, patient-centred care by expanding and decentralising diagnosis and treatment services. Ensure universal health cover by making available suitable resources to treat/prevent tuberculosis and by improving cooperation with communities, state organisations and private and public healthcare partners. Promote research and innovations. Reinforcer the national health information system (gradual implementation of DHIS2) and the monitoring and follow-up/assessment system for activities to inform appropriate decisions to meet the challenges of public health growth in Chad. Maternal, neonatal and infant mortality linked to HIV to be reduced by 50% by 2022

title.narrative: Percentage of people living with HIV initiated on ART who are screened for TB in HIV treatment settings
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases
Percentage of people living with HIV newly enrolled in HIV care started on TB preventive therapy
Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Percentage of health facilities with essential medicines and life-saving commodities in stock
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified

Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
Percentage of registered new and relapse TB patients with documented HIV status
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment
